title: [K-12] Neuroscience Module-Based Flipped Learning Simulation Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic neuroscience and medical terminology, experience with VR devices
context.additional_context: Neuroscience curriculum for medical graduate students combining VR simulation and flipped learning: Self-directed learning with BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) alongside real-time collaborative activities

learning_goals: Students can accurately analyze the three-dimensional structure of neural networks through VR simulations
Learners can comparatively explain the pathological mechanisms of five central nervous system disorders based on flipped learning video materials

In team-based projects (4 members/team), learners analyze three clinical cases related to neurodegenerative diseases (e.g., Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s) and present ≥1 creative problem-solving solution using mathematical modeling (statistical analysis/optimization techniques) in PPT/report format, achieving ≥4 average points on peer and instructor evaluation criteria (5-point scale)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
